# CXStartCallAction

**Class**

An encapsulation of the act of initiating an outgoing call.

## Declaration

```swift
class CXStartCallAction
```

## Overview

[doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXStartCallAction] is a concrete subclass of [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXCallAction]. When the user initiates an outgoing call, the provider sends [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXProviderDelegate/provider(_:perform:)-2lem5] to its delegate. The provider’s delegate calls the [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXAction/fulfill()] method to indicate that the action was successfully performed. To indicate that the call started at a time other than the current time, you can instead call the [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXStartCallAction/fulfill(withDateStarted:)].

## Creating New Actions

- **init(call:handle:)**: Initializes a new action to start a call with the specified UUID to a recipient with the specified handle.
- **init(coder:)**: Creates a new action to start a call with data in an unarchiver.

## Accessing Action Attributes

- **isVideo**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the call is a video call.
- **contactIdentifier**: The identifier for the call recipient.
- **handle**: The handle of the call recipient.

## Completing Actions

- **fulfill(withDateStarted:)**: Reports the successful execution of the action at the specified time.

## Outgoing calls

- **Sending End-to-End Encrypted VoIP Calls**: Initiate VoIP calls when your server can’t determine whether an outgoing notification is a request for a VoIP call due to metadata encryption.
- **CXCallController**: A programmatic interface for interacting with and observing calls.
- **CXTransaction**: An object that contains zero or more action objects for a call controller to perform.

## Inherits From

- CXCallAction

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSCoding
- NSCopying
- NSObjectProtocol
- NSSecureCoding
